title: Antonio Caggiano 2016 Falanghina (Campania)
description: Delicately scented, this offers aromas of Spanish broom, Mediterranean scrub and yellow stone fruit. On the medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity supports mature yellow apple, lemon zest and a hint of toasted hazelnut.

title: Balbas 2015 Ardal Tradición  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oak-derived aromas of maple, charred wood and clove are pronounced on the nose. The full-bodied palate offers grainy tannins and strong charred oak notes that leave a charcoal-infused berry impression. Its flat, slightly stewed finish is bolstered by a shot of lemony acidity.

title: Banfi 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Truffle, new leather, ripe blackberry and toasted aromas are front and center. The straightforward light-bodied palate offers tart cherry, pomegranate, clove and a hint of espresso alongside close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity.

title: Banfi 2015 Fonte alla Selva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Raspberry jam, underbrush and blue flower aromas lead the nose. The palate shows mature blackberry, cassis and a hint of ground pepper alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Barkan 2016 Classic Pinot Noir (Negev)
description: This wine has aromas of plum, cassis and juniper. Midweight tannins provide a framework for flavors of cherry, black currant, pomegranate, leather and soft spice. It offers nice depth of flavor right into a zippy cranberry finish.

title: Barnard Griffin 2016 Port Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vanilla, plum and spice aromas are followed by sweet, saturated fruit flavors in this wine. It brings a pleasing kick of spice on the finish.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Crucillón Red (Campo de Borja)
description: This wine's dusty raspberry and plum aromas are friendly and powdery. A 50-50 blend of Garnacha and Tempranillo, it's lively and tight, with generic black fruit flavors that finish minty and a touch raw.

title: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Cream Sherry (Jerez)
description: Piercing apricot and peach aromas offer a live-wire start to this cream Sherry. On the palate, high acidity cuts through any thickness. Chocolate, canned peach and apricot flavors run deep into the finish, with toffee and mocha accents.

title: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Riá Pitá Sherry (Manzanilla-Sanlúcar de Barrameda)
description: This wine's precocious nose includes nutty stone fruit and talcum powder aromas. Its full yet fresh palate is rich, with salted dried apple and peanut flavors. It finishes on a base note of salted nuts.

title: Brandborg 2015 Hundredth Valley Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)
description: This wine's fruit runs toward pomegranate rather than berry, and the tannins have a slightly dusty character. Barrel aging has given it a finishing wash of mocha.

title: Cantine Astroni 2016 Colle Imperatrice Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)
description: Aromas of sea brine, brimstone, crushed rock and citrus lead the nose. Light bodied and linear, the fresh palate offers lemon-lime, yellow pear and a savory hint of saline alongside bright acidity.

title: Cantine Olivella 2016 Summa Catalanesca (Catalanesca del Monte Somma)
description: Made with 100% Catalanesca, this opens with heady aromas of fragrant yellow flower, exotic fruit and citrus. The vibrant light-bodied palate offers white grapefruit, pineapple and saline. It closes on a bitter-almond note.

title: Casas del Toqui 2017 Coastal Series Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Freshness is this Sauvignon Blanc's virtue. Its clear color and sharp citrus peel and sweat aromas lead to a fresh and punchy yet slick palate. With its salty lime and persimmon flavors, it finishes tight and lean, with limited weight and volume.

title: Casca Wines 2016 Cascas Tinto Red (Lisboa)
description: This is a young wine, bursting with red fruits and crisp acidity. Its tannins, soft and already well integrated, are well in balance. The wine is ripe and attractive to drink from late 2018.

title: Castello di Meleto 2015 Meleto  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, tobacco and blue flower take center stage. The easygoing palate shows juicy Marasca cherry, cinnamon and a touch of star anise alongside lithe tannins.

title: Castelvecchi 2014 Lodolaio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This offers aromas reminiscent of cedar, black-skinned fruit and a subtle whiff of oak. The firm palate doles out dried black cherry, vanilla and a mocha note set against taut assertive tannins.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Vintage Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 6% Petit Verdot, this is a hearty and succulent wine, brimming in blackberry and tobacco. It is marked by dry substantial tannins that mellow slowly on the finish.

title: Charles Père et Fille 2015 La Combotte  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)
description: This perfumed, ripe wine shows the richness of the vintage, even in cooler vineyards. Generous red-berry fruits give a rich wine that is full and softly textured. It can age another year, so drink from 2019.

title: Château Bélingard 2015 Réserve  (Monbazillac)
description: Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon nurture the botrytis and honey in this wine. It has a dry edge to the apricot and bitter marmalade flavors, with just a hint of acidity. Drink this ripe, sweet wine from 2019.

title: Château de Gaudou 2016 Tradition Malbec-Merlot Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: Firm and tannic, this structured wine is still young. Black fruits await behind a strong facade that will take time to crumble and integrate into the potential of the berry fruits. Wait on this wine and don't drink before 2021.

title: Château Famaey 2015 Malbec (Cahors)
description: The entry-level wine from this estate, this is all about black-currant fruit and balanced acidity. It has the typical firm Malbec tannins but these are toned down by the bright, fruity nature of the wine. Drink this wine from 2020.

title: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2016 Tradition Malbec (Cahors)
description: This young wine is all about fruit. Juicy black-currant and berry flavors are right up front, ably backed by the crisp acidity and layer of dry tannins. It will be a deliciously fruity wine from 2019.

title: Château Lagrézette 2016 Purple The Original Malbec Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is Lagrézette's easy-drinking wine. With soft tannins and bright black fruits, it is ripe, without any oak aging. Juicy acidity and berry flavors give the wine an easy character. It will be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: City Winery Chicago 2015 The Wine That Does Not Speak Its Name Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Oaky sage, pencil and dried herb provide an earthy context around which smooth, rounded and approachable texture is built. The wine moderately complex and medium bodied, blended with 4% Merlot.
designation: The Wine That Does Not Speak Its Name

title: Coeur de Terre 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Crisp and spicy, this melds apple, pear and white peach fruit with riper, more tropical flavors. It's a versatile style of Pinot Gris that finishes dry despite its 2 g/L of residual sugar.

title: Coto de Hayas 2016 Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)
description: This Garnacha-Syrah blend is crisp and lively. Its generic berry and plum aromas are fresh and clean, with a hint of rubber. Blackberry, plum and grape skin flavors end in snappy fashion.

title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2016  Chablis
description: Star winemaker Fabien Moreau makes a delicious Chablis, full of fruit, crisp with acidity and with a light, steely edge. This wine is all fruit, ripe lemon and green apple with a tight, fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

title: Domaine de Cause 2015 Malbec (Cahors)
description: This rich blackberry and black-plum flavored wine has tannins although the ripe fruit sings. It is structured, but this never detracts from the great fruitiness of the wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Europa Village NV Annabel Brut Sparkling (Temecula Valley)
description: Clean aromas of Asian pear, light honeysuckle, fresh lemon and a bit of chalk show on the light and delicate nose of this bottling. Clean and frothy bubbles present the tang of green citrus and green apples on the palate, which is mellow, soft and very enjoyable.

title: Foursight 2016 Charles Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: This cheery wine has a lot of vibrant fruit flavors including lemon, grapefruit and crisp apple that refresh the palate, along with light spice notes of vanilla and ginger and perhaps a touch of sweetness.
